mapper.select:
with recursive fn_recipe_comment as ( select 1 as clevel, recipe_no as recipeNo, comment_no as commentNo, comment_parent_no as commentParentNo, comment_content as commentContent, comment_writer as commentWriter, comment_createdate as commentCreateDate, comment_moddate as commentModDate, comment_status as commentStatus
from RECIPE_COMMENT
where recipe_no = 14
union all
select c.clevel + 1 , b.recipe_no as recipeNo , b.comment_no as commentNo , b.comment_parent_no as commentParentNo , b.comment_content as commentContent , b.comment_writer as commentWriter , b.comment_createdate as commentCreateDate , b.comment_moddate as commentModDate , b.comment_status as commentStatus from recipe_comment b, fn_recipe_comment c
where c.commentNo = b.comment_parent_no ) select * from fn_recipe_comment

select recipe_no as recipeNo, comment_no as commentNo, comment_parent_no as commentParentNo, comment_content as commentContent, comment_writer as commentWriter, comment_createdate as commentCreateDate, comment_moddate as commentModDate, comment_status as commentStatus from recipe_comment where comment_no = #{value}
mapper.insert: insert into recipe_comment (recipe_no, comment_content, comment_writer, comment_parent_no) values (#{recipeNo}, #{commentContent}, #{commentWriter}, #{commentParentNo})
mapper.update: update recipe_comment set comment_content = #{commentContent}, comment_writer = #{commentWriter}, comment_moddate = now(), comment_status = 'N' where comment_no = #{commentNo}
update recipe_comment set comment_content = #{commentContent}, comment_moddate = now() where comment_no = #{commentNo}
